title: First Direct Arena
description: The First Direct Arena is a 13,500 capacity entertainment focused arena in Leeds, West Yorkshire, England. It is the first in the United Kingdom to have a fan-shaped orientation.

title: Royal Armouries
description: The Royal Armouries Museum in Leeds, West Yorkshire, England, is a national museum which displays the National Collection of Arms and Armour.

title: Leeds Art Gallery
description: Leeds Art Gallery in Leeds, West Yorkshire, England, is a museum whose collection of 20th-century British Art is recognised by the British government as a collection 'of national importance'.

title: Grand Theatre & Opera House
description: The Grand Theatre, also known as Leeds Grand Theatre and Leeds Grand Theatre and Opera House, is a theatre and opera house in the centre of Leeds, West Yorkshire, England.

title: Leeds City Museum
description: Leeds City Museum, originally established in 1819, reopened on 13 September 2008 in Leeds, West Yorkshire, England.

title: Leeds Kirkgate Market
description: Leeds Kirkgate Market is a market in Leeds, West Yorkshire, England located on Vicar Lane. It is the largest covered market in Europe.

title: West Yorkshire Playhouse
description: Leeds Playhouse is a theatre in the city of Leeds, West Yorkshire, in the north of England. It opened in 1990 as the West Yorkshire Playhouse, successor to the original Leeds Playhouse, and was rebranded in June 2018 to revert to the title 'Leeds Playhouse'. It has two auditoria and hosts a wide range of productions and engages in outreach work in the local community.

title: Merrion Centre
description: The Merrion Centre is a shopping centre in Leeds, England. Since opening in 1964, the centre has been owned and managed by Town Centre Securities. Originally open air, the centre had a roof installed during the 1970s.

title: Woodhouse Moor Park
description: Woodhouse Moor is an open space approximately one mile from Leeds city centre, West Yorkshire, England.

title: Abbey House Museum
description: Abbey House Museum in Kirkstall, Leeds, West Yorkshire, England is housed in the gatehouse of the ruined Kirkstall Abbey, and is a Grade II* listed building. The house is 3 miles north west of Leeds city centre on the A65 road.

title: Roundhay Park
description: Roundhay Park in Leeds, West Yorkshire, England, is one of the biggest city parks in Europe. It has more than 700 acres of parkland, lakes, woodland and gardens which are owned by Leeds City Council.

title: White Rose Centre
description: The White Rose Centre is a shopping centre in the Beeston area of Leeds, West Yorkshire, England. It spans two floors and is near the M621 motorway. It takes its name from the White Rose of York, the traditional symbol of Yorkshire.

title: City Varieties Music Hall
description: Ornate, restored 19th-century music hall for behind-the-scenes morning tours, live music and comedy.

title: Victoria Quarter
description: Victoria Leeds is a shopping and leisure area in Leeds city centre. It combines the 1990 Victoria Quarter west of Vicar Lane and the 2016 Victoria Gate shopping centre east of Vicar Lane.

title: Corn Exchange
description: The Leeds Corn Exchange is a Victorian building in Leeds, West Yorkshire, England, which was designed by Cuthbert Brodrick and completed in 1864.

title: Northern Ballet
description: Inventive modern dance company with theatre hosting many types of dance performances and lessons.
